name: Hotel George

reviews.text: I was able to stay here in January when the rates were lower. Hotel George is a mid-size hotel. I stayed in a mid-size room with a marble restroom. The bed was very comfortable and I especially enjoyed the wool throw blanket that I used while sitting in the easy chair. The staff members were helpful and welcoming, especially when my flight was canceled. I did eat breakfast at the attached restaurant and the service was surprisingly quick and the food good. The location is about two blocks from Union Station Metro.
reviews.title: Friendly service sets the tone here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located close to all the monuments and museums. The room was very clean and comfortable. We couldn't have had better service from the staff as well. Also, the complimentary hot chocolate and wine tastings were a plus. When I go back to D.C., I will be staying here.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very close to the Union Station, where it has a lot of restaurants and the train station. This is an advantage.
reviews.title: almost good..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weakness in my opinion is that some people of staff is no so friendly.
reviews.title: Elegant hotel in prime Capitol Hill location, and well-run by superb staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is so expensive.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Hotel George for 3 nights for a quick trip to DC. This was our first time in DC so we weren't too familiar with the area. We got lost tryign to find this hotel... probably just because we were out-of-towners and didn't understand the street directions at first! Anyways, once we found the hotel we were quite impressed with the location. It's only a 5 minute walk from Union Station which was convenient to get to all the sites. It's also a convenient walk to Chinatown and other parts of DC. We love to walk and explore so we had no problem walking 2-3 miles around town.
reviews.title: Great for a short stay!

reviews.text: The rooms were small but adequate for a short stay. We had a queen bed that took up most of the room, a small TV and a small bathroom. There was also a pull-down bed that we didn't utilize. Our room faced out towards the trash (not a great view!) so we were woken up early on trash day but it wasn't a big deal really. The newspaper was delivered daily outside our room.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience...we plan on making it an annual pilgramage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very quiet and clean. I liked the decor in the lobby. There was a wine tasting one evening in the lobby and they had other little events going on at the restaurant attached to the hotel. Overall, a great, inexpensive (for DC!) stay for a couple of days. If I were staying for a week or more I'd probably go elsewhere just for space reasons.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel great price
Very good...but
reviews.text: Stayed one night on 1/18 with four other couples. It was restaurant week so getting a reservation anywhere was brutal. We were literally walking out the lobby door to a third-tier restaurant when one of my party told the host at Bistro Bis of our predicament. They offered to put my group (party of 13) in the hotel's conference room, (effectively creating our own private dining room), and then let us order off the special restaurant menu. Service was exemplary, food fantastic, and we all felt like VIP's. Just a phenomenal experience. Maitre'd (George?) was all over us with great service..very attentive and professional, and a sense of humor to boot. We'll definetly be back.

this was a beautiful hotel in a great walking location. there is a self park garage that you can park in for ten dollars a day instead of valet parking for 40 dollars. the staff was very friendly. very close to the metro
reviews.title: This is the way to run a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a rare opportunity to spend a night out and attend an event at the Verizon Center we selected the Hotel George based on its reputation for being such a warm and welcoming hotel for guests on their own as well as being "The" place to stay for those with business at the Capital which is next door. We were not disappointed at all and were delighted with our stay. General Manager and his staff always seemed to be in the lobby greeting and helping guests and later assisted with 'wine hour' , a nice amenity, and they were there in the morning thanking guests and offering assistance. Our room was immaculate and lighting in the bathroom was great. It was a cold night when we stayed and the room temperature was perfect as was the comfort of the bed allowing for a great night's sleep after the evening event we attended. Valet was quick with our car both with arriving and leaving. The hotel is right next door to Union Station which also has a Metro station . If the weather was bad or we couldn't find a cab we knew that we could take the Metro however cabs were readily available and it was a quick and inexpensive side back to the hotel ( we walked there and it was a pleasant 10-12 minute walk). The Bistro Bis restaurant that is connected to the hotel was a nice surprise. It is a well rated restaurant with a nice decor, great food (both at dinner and breakfast) and a fabulous alternative to what you might get in an upscale hotel like Marriott or Hyatt. We look forward to an opportunity to return to the Hotel George and enjoy the staff's gracious service. The only negative to staying at the Hotel George is that we had to check-out , but the fun in that is that we can look forward to returning.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay at the Hotel George

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I took a getaway trip to DC for our 22-1/2 year anniversary. I found this hotel on TripAdvisor and gambled on it. We were wonderfully surprised at the quality of hotel for the budget price ($110 per night) in downtown DC. I mentioned to the reservationist that it was our 22-1/2 year anniversary as a joke, but when we showed up in our room they had provided wine and chocolate and a nice note of congratulations. They staff were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great hotel and a great value, it's become our place to stay in DC.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was immaculate and the bed comfortable. The location is close to Union Station and the Capital. It's a great location if you can stomach the thought of being that close to so many Congressmen and Senators at the Capital. (That's a joke by the way). It's only a short walk to the Smithsonian museums.
reviews.title: Kimpton does it again ...

reviews.text: I was saddened that they don't provide free wifi, which seems to be a staple for any traveler these days. The valet parking is also expensive ($40 with unlimited entry/exit). I suggest parking across the street at the Colonial parking which is only $10 per day if you leave your car there all day. DC has good public transportation and the museums are in close walking distance so having ready access to a car is not required. The restaurant is very good but pricey. If you're on a budget, I suggest the Starbucks one block west of the hotel where an entire breakfast can be had for the price of the orange juice at the hotel.
reviews.title: Not worth the money - awful heating situation

reviews.text: Check in was quick and easy and we were shown to our very well appointed room by the helpful bellstaff. The bed wes comfy as were the pillows and the temp control was very welcome during the very cold post Christmas period. The hotel is a 5 minute stroll from Union Station which has a great variety of shops and places to eat. A bit of a walk if you wanted the main area for restaurants, but taxis are cheap and plentiful.
reviews.title: Nice, but not a 4 star

reviews.text: I found this hotel on-line when looking for a good deal on a room.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel was a little hard to find on getting there. Staff at the hotel is extremely friendly and go out of their way to help out. I arrived earlier than check in time, the reception staff was very helpful and gave me an early check-in. Rooms were fresh, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious too.
reviews.title: Everything we could want

reviews.text: This hotel was my home away from home. I will be visiting this hotel again next year!
reviews.title: Not impressed, by George.

reviews.text: We got a great rate on this hotel and it truly came with everything we could want - a super location (less than 2 blocks to Union Station, which is a safe, clean metro stop, Amtrak station, and shopping area), a clean, modern, and comfortable room, FREE internet access (LOVE that!), and a large, clean bathroom with Aveda products. My husband forgot cufflinks and the front desk even had a very nice pair that they loaned him.
reviews.title: Hospitality with a CAPITAL H!

reviews.text: I've stayed in some very nice hotels, and this is just as great (if not better) than those hotels for a much better rate. Would highly recommend!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

description: Located on Capitol Hill, the Hotel George stands out as one of the most stylish boutique hotels in Washington DC. This luxury hotel offers celebrity appeal, impeccable service and extraordinary value in an ideal location. Hotel George, at the nucleus of Capitol Hill’s business district, is steps from Union Station and the U.S. Capitol Building and a short walk from the National Mall, Smithsonian Museums, and the U.S. House of Representatives and Senate Office Buildings.
